hints.content:
Now, let's use a place value chart to write $796{,}332$ in expanded form.

Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens |  Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:| :-:
$\redD7$ | $\goldD9$| $\tealD6$ | $\blueD3$ | $\purpleD3$ | $\greenD2$

$796{,}332=\redD{700{,}000}+\goldD{90{,}000}+\tealD{6{,}000}+\blueD{300}+\purpleD{30}+\greenD{2}$

Now, let's break our number into parts to write it in word form:
$\tealD{796}{,}\maroonD{332}$

$\tealD{\text{Seven hundred ninety-six thousand}}$ is to the left of the comma. 

 $\maroonD{\text{Three hundred thirty-two}}$ is to the right of the comma.

If we combine the parts, we write $796{,}332$ as seven hundred ninety-six thousand, three hundred thirty-two.

This is the completed chart:

Standard Form | Word Form | Expanded Form
- | - | -
$796{,}332$ | Seven hundred ninety-six thousand, three hundred thirty-two. | ${700{,}000}+{90{,}000}+{6{,}000}+{300}+{30}+2$

question.content:
**Complete the chart so all three forms equal the same number.**

Standard Form | Word Form | Expanded Form
- | - | -
$796{,}332$ | [[☃ dropdown 1]] | [[☃ dropdown 2]]

choices.content: Seven hundred ninety-six thousand, three hundred thirty-two
Seven hundred sixty-nine thousand, three hundred thirty-two
Seven hundred ninety-three thousand, three hundred thirty-two
